ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] 17th Level
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Whoops, when last I heard the word on how these things worked (some time ago) you did a check for Dual Weild at the end of every primary attack. A faster
ygData.messageBody:
>Ack, halt right there.
>
>Dual wielding is completely independant.
>
>The delay of your primary hand has nothing to do with the delay of your off
>hand. That being said, if you want to dual wield a lot, put a very fast
>weapon into your off hand.
>


Whoops, when last I heard the word on how these things worked (some time
ago) you did a check for Dual Weild at the end of every primary attack. A
faster weapon in your primary hand meant more checks, likely meaning more
dual weilding. No?


>At lower levels, with no minimum damage, the conventional theory is to put
>the faster weapon in the off hand so that you will dual weild more.


Yow, that's what I get for being gone for so long. Thanks,

Tszaaz
